“ -----
Mr* Jack M. Burke
Office of Extension Radio and Television
Kansas State University
Manhattan, Kansas 66502
Dear Mr. Bua:ke:
Acknowledging your letter of February 22, as perhaps
you know, the Educational Television Facilities Act
introduced March 2 includes provisions for educational
radio. Hearings have not yet been scheduled on the bill,
pending before the Senate Commerce Committee.
We are glad to have your views and will be glad to re¬
ceive the additional material you mention.
Sincerelyj
